Steam (ST): The biggest fall event for the Ushiromiya family was the family conference in October, but to Jessica, there was another major event that came before that: the school cultural festival.
Umineko Project (UP): The biggest event for the Ushiromiya family in fall was the family conference in October, but for Jessica, there was another one before that: the school cultural festival.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): The biggest event for the Ushiromiya family in fall was the family conference in October, but to Jessica, there was another one before that: the school cultural festival.
PC Japanese (JP): 右代宮家にとって秋にある最大の行事は、１０月にある親族会議ただひとつだったが、朱志香にとってはその前にもうひとつ、学校の文化祭があった。
Russian (RU): Крупнейшим событием для семьи Уширомия осенью было семейное собрание в октябре. Но у Джессики было ещё одно событие, по важности перевешивающее общий слёт семьи, а именно: культурный фестиваль школы.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): O maior evento para a família Ushiromiya no outono era a conferência familiar em outubro, mas, para Jessica, havia outro antes desse: o festival cultural da escola.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 對右代宮家來說秋天最重要的活動，就只有在十月召開的親族會議那麼一個，但對朱志香而言，在這之前還有一個，那就是學校的文化祭。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 对右代宫家来说秋天最重要的活动，就只有在十月召开的亲族会议那么一个，但对朱志香而言，在这之前还有一个，那就是学校的文化祭。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Il più grande evento per la famiglia Ushiromiya in autunno era la riunione di famiglia di ottobre, ma per Jessica, ce n'era un altro prima di quello: il festival culturale della scuola.
Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): Per la famiglia Ushiromiya, l'evento più importante dell'autunno era la riunione di famiglia ad ottobre, ma per Jessica ce n'era un altro che lo precedeva: il festival scolastico.
Turkish (TR): Ushiromiya ailesi için sonbahardaki en büyük etkinlik Ekim ayındaki aile konferansıydı, ama Jessica için bundan önce bir tane daha vardı: okul kültür festivali.

Steam (ST): Jessica liked school. To her, it was a place where she could let out the stress she'd built up from the rigid lifestyle she was forced to lead at home.
Umineko Project (UP): Jessica liked school; to her, it was a place where she could let out the stress she'd built up during the rigid lifestyle she was forced to lead at home.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Jessica liked school. To her, it was a place where she could let out the stress she'd built up during the rigid lifestyle she was forced to lead at home.
PC Japanese (JP): 朱志香にとって学校生活は、堅苦しい生活を強いられる日々のストレスを発散できるお気に入りの場所だった。
Russian (RU): Джессика любила школу, где она могла сбросить стресс после дней, в течение которых она вынуждена была жить, соблюдая формальности.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Jessica gostava da escola; para ela, era um lugar onde ela podia liberar o estresse que havia acumulado durante o rígido estilo de vida que era forçada a levar em casa.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 在朱志香看來，學校是個讓她非常中意的地方。平日裡被逼著嚴于律己的她，能在校園生活中釋放積壓已久的壓力。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 在朱志香看来，学校是个让她非常中意的地方。平日里被逼着严于律己的她，能在校园生活中释放积压已久的压力。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): A Jessica piaceva la scuola. Per lei, era un posto dove poteva scaricare lo stress accumulato per il rigido stile di vita che era costretta tenere a casa.
Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): La scuola era il luogo preferito di Jessica, dove poteva rilasciare lo stress dei giorni in cui era costretta a seguire uno stile di vita formale.
Turkish (TR): Jessica okulu seviyordu; ona göre okul, evde sürdürmek zorunda kaldığı katı yaşam tarzı boyunca biriktirdiği stresi atabileceği bir yerdi.

Steam (ST): For today's cultural festival, she'd formed a group with her friends... and had announced that they'd perform some light music on a temporary stage.
Umineko Project (UP): For the cultural festival today, she had formed a group with her friends, and would be performing casual pop‐rock on a temporary stage.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): For the cultural festival today, she had formed a group with her friends, and had announced that they would perform light music on a temporary stage.
PC Japanese (JP): 今日の文化祭でも、彼女は友人たちとグループを組み、仮設舞台で軽音楽の発表をすることになっていた。
Russian (RU): Для сегодняшнего фестиваля она сформировала группу с друзьями, и объявила, что будет играть лёгкую музыку на временной сцене.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Para o festival cultural de hoje, ela havia formado um grupo com suas amigas, e estaria tocando pop‐rock casual em um palco temporário.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 今天的文化祭，她也和朋友們組成了樂隊，要在臨時舞台上演奏輕音樂。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 今天的文化祭，她也和朋友们组成了乐队，要在临时舞台上演奏轻音乐。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Per il festival culturale di oggi, aveva formato un gruppo con i suoi amici, e aveva dichiarato che avrebbero suonato musica leggera su un palco provvisorio.
Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): Per il festival di quel giorno, Jessica mise su una band con le sue amiche, e fu deciso che avrebbero presentato della musica pop su un palco provvisorio.
Turkish (TR): Bugünkü kültür festivali için arkadaşlarıyla bir grup oluşturmuştu, ve kurulan geçici sahnede sıradan bir pop-rock performansı sergileyeceklerdi.

Steam (ST): She had prepared and practiced for this over and over until today, always anxiously awaiting this day's arrival, ......but there was one thing that worried her.
Umineko Project (UP): She had kept on preparing and practicing for that, and was really looking forward to today, .........but there was one thing that had been worrying her.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): She had kept on preparing and practicing for that, and had really looked forward to today, .........but there was one thing that had worried her.
PC Japanese (JP): そのために今日まで準備と練習を重ね、今日の当日を楽しみにしていたのだが、………ある一点だけが悩みだった。
Russian (RU): Поэтому она готовилась и репетировала и с огромным нетерпением ожидала этого дня. .........Но имелось кое‐что, заставляющее её нервничать.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Ela havia continuamente se preparado e ensaiado para isso, e estava realmente ansiosa pelo dia de hoje, .........mas havia uma coisa que estava a preocupando.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 雖然她為了這場表演做了種種練習和準備，也一直盼著這一天的到來，………但還是有一件事讓她頗感苦惱。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 虽然她为了这场表演做了种种练习和准备，也一直盼着这一天的到来，………但还是有一件事让她颇感苦恼。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Lei aveva continuato a prepararsi ed esercitarsi per quello, e aveva atteso con trepidazione... ma c'era una cosa che la preoccupava.
Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): Per questo motivo, si era preparata ed esercitata senza sosta per quel momento, non vedendo l'ora che arrivasse il giorno in questione, ma... c'era solo una cosa che la preoccupava.
Turkish (TR): Bu güne kadar hazırlanmaya ve pratik yapmaya devam etmişti ve bugünü gerçekten dört gözle bekliyordu, .........ama onu endişelendiren bir şey vardı.

Steam (ST): She looked at the clock. ...There was still a little time, ...but she felt uneasy.
Umineko Project (UP): She looked at the clock. ...There was still a little time, ...but she was uneasy.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): She looked at the clock....There was still a little time, ...but she was uneasy.
PC Japanese (JP): 時計を見る。…まだ時間までは少しあるが、…不安だった。
Russian (RU): Она посмотрела на часы. Было ещё немного времени... Но на душе у неё скребли кошки.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Ela olhou para o relógio. ...Ainda havia um tempinho, ...mas ela estava inquieta.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 看了下鐘。…雖說還有些時間，…但還是按捺不住心中的不安。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 看了下钟。…虽说还有些时间，…但还是按捺不住心中的不安。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Guardò l'orologio. ... C'era ancora un pò di tempo... ma si sentiva a disagio.
Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): Guardò l'orologio... Rimaneva ancora un po' di tempo... ma era agitata.
Turkish (TR): Saate baktı. ...Hâlâ biraz zaman vardı. ...ama tedirgindi.

Steam (ST): Would that person really come?
Umineko Project (UP): Would he really come?
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Would that person really come?
PC Japanese (JP): ちゃんと来てくれるだろうか。
Russian (RU): Придёт ли он?
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Ele realmente viria?
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 真的會按時來嗎？
Chinese Simplified (CN): 真的会按时来吗？
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Quella persona verrà davvero?
Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): Sarebbe riuscito ad arrivare in tempo?
Turkish (TR): O gerçekten gelecek miydi?

Steam (ST): After taking a single deep breath, her heart jumped when all her friends suddenly started speaking in shrill voices.
Umineko Project (UP): As she was about to breathe out a stress‐relieving sigh, her heart jumped as all her friends suddenly started speaking in shrill voices.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): After taking a single deep breath, her heart jumped when all her friends suddenly started speaking in shrill voices.
PC Japanese (JP): ため息をつこうとしたら、友人たちが黄色い声を一斉に上げたので心臓が飛び上がった。
Russian (RU): После глубокого вздоха, её сердце ёкнуло, когда вдруг все её подруги запищали пронзительными голосами.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Quando ela estava prestes a soltar um suspiro para aliviar o estresse, seu coração pulou enquanto todas as suas amigas começaram a falar em vozes agudas.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 正打算作一次深呼吸時，周圍朋友們異口同聲地發出了尖叫，使她的心臟都快跳出來了。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 正打算作一次深呼吸时，周围朋友们异口同声地发出了尖叫，使她的心脏都快跳出来了。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Dopo aver preso un profondo respiro, il suo cuore sobbalzò quando tutti i suoi amici incominciarono improvvisamente a parlare con voci stridule.
Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): Quando fece per tirare un sospiro, le voci striduli delle sue amiche che si levarono all'unisono le fecero venire un colpo al cuore.
Turkish (TR): Stres atıcı bir iç çekiş yapmak üzereyken, tüm arkadaşlarının aniden tiz seslerle konuşmaya başlamasıyla kalbi yerinden fırladı.

Steam (ST): "No wa-y, Hina's boyfriend's so a-wesome!!"
Umineko Project (UP): "No wayyyy, Hina's boyfriend's a to~tal stud!!"
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "No wa-y, Hina's boyfriend's so a~wesome!!"

Steam (ST): ...It may not be like this for all girls, ...but at least at Jessica's school, the cultural festival was basically a boyfriend exhibition.
Umineko Project (UP): ......It's not necessarily the case that all girls are like this, ...but at Jessica's school at least, the cultural festival was really a boyfriend exhibition.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): ......None of the girls would say it, ...but to them, the cultural festival at Jessica's school was really a boyfriend exhibition.
PC Japanese (JP): ……全ての女性にとってそうだとは言わないが、…少なくとも朱志香の学校での文化祭は、彼氏の品評会と同じ意味だった。
Russian (RU): ......Ни одна из них не сказала бы этого вслух... Но для них культурный фестиваль в школе Джессики на самом деле был скорее выставкой парней.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ......Não é que todas as garotas sejam assim, ...mas, pelo menos na escola de Jessica, o festival cultural era realmente uma exibição de namorados.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): ……雖說並不是對所有女性都是如此，…但至少在朱志香的學校裡，文化祭的意義就等同於男朋友品評會。
Chinese Simplified (CN): ……虽说并不是对所有女性都是如此，…但至少在朱志香的学校里，文化祭的意义就等同于男朋友品评会。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): ... Nessuna delle ragazze l'avrebbe detto... ma per loro, il festival culturale alla scuola di Jessica era realmente una mostra dei propri ragazzi.
Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): ...Non si sta cercando di dire che tutte le ragazze fossero così... ma, quantomeno nella scuola di Jessica, il festival scolastico era praticamente una messa in mostra dei propri fidanzati.
Turkish (TR): ......Tüm genç kızların böyle olduğu söylenemez, ...ama en azından Jessica'nın okulunda kültür festivali gerçekten de bir erkek arkadaş sergisiydi.

Steam (ST): Jessica didn't have a boyfriend. She had many friends of the opposite sex, but no special "only one".
Umineko Project (UP): Jessica didn't have a boyfriend.{n}She had many friends of the opposite sex, but no "special one".
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Jessica didn't have a boyfriend. She had many friends of the opposite sex, but no special 'only one'.
PC Japanese (JP): 朱志香には彼氏がいない。異性の友人は多いのだが、特定のオンリーワンはいない。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 朱志香には彼氏がいない。{n}異性の友人は多いのだが、特定のオンリーワンはいない。
Russian (RU): У Джессики не было парня.{n}У неё было множество друзей противоположного пола, но не было "того единственного".
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Jessica não tinha um namorado.{n}Ela tinha muitos amigos do sexo oposto, mas nenhum "especial".
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 朱志香沒有男朋友。{n}異性朋友倒確實有不少，但並沒有特別的 only one。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 朱志香没有男朋友。{n}异性朋友倒确实有不少，但并没有特别的 only one。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Jessica non aveva il ragazzo. Aveva alcuni amici del sesso opposto, ma nessuno ‘di speciale’.
Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): Jessica non aveva un ragazzo.{n}Aveva molti amici del sesso opposto, ma nessuno di essi era ‘quello speciale’...
Turkish (TR): Jessica'nın bir erkek arkadaşı yoktu.{n}Karşı cinsten pek çok arkadaşı vardı ama "özel biri" yoktu.

Steam (ST): ...But Jessica was a little famous around the school, and everyone thought it'd be natural for her to have a fitting partner.
Umineko Project (UP): ...But Jessica was a little famous around the school, and everyone naturally expected that she had a fitting partner.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): ...But Jessica was a little famous around the school, and everyone thought it would be natural for her to have a fitting partner.
PC Japanese (JP): …しかし朱志香は学校ではちょっとした有名人で、それに見合うパートナーがいて当然だと思われていた。
Russian (RU): ...Джессика была достаточно известна в пределах школы, и все думали, что для неё естественно иметь достойного партнёра.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ...No entanto, Jessica era um pouco famosa pela escola, e todos naturalmente esperavam que ela tivesse um parceiro adequado.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): …不過朱志香在學校是個小有名氣的名人，大家也都自然而然地以為，她必然會有個相般配的男伴。
Chinese Simplified (CN): …不过朱志香在学校是个小有名气的名人，大家也都自然而然地以为，她必然会有个相般配的男伴。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): ... Ma Jessica era piuttosto famosa a scuola, e tutti pensavano che sarebbe stato naturale per lei avere un partner adatto.
Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): Ma Jessica era abbastanza popolare a scuola, ed era dato per scontato che avesse un compagno adeguato a lei.
Turkish (TR): ...Ancak Jessica okul çevresinde biraz ünlüydü ve herkes doğal olarak ona uygun bir partneri olmasını bekliyordu.

Steam (ST): Furthermore, her pride had led her to pretend that this was true.
Umineko Project (UP): Furthermore, her pride had caused her to act like that was the case.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Furthermore, her pride had caused her to act like that was the case.
PC Japanese (JP): また、彼女の見栄っ張りなプライドもあたかもそうであるかのように振舞わせてきた。
Russian (RU): Тем более, её гордость заставляла её вести себя, словно так оно и есть.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Além do mais, seu orgulho havia feito com que ela agisse como se esse fosse o caso.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 而且，她那死要面子的自尊心也使她一直都裝出一副正是如此的樣子。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 而且，她那死要面子的自尊心也使她一直都装出一副正是如此的样子。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Per di più, il suo orgoglio la faceva agire come se quello fosse il caso.
Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): E inoltre, il suo orgoglio e la sua vanità l'avevano spinta a comportarsi come se ne avesse uno.
Turkish (TR): Dahası, gururu onun durum böyleymiş gibi davranmasına neden olmuştu.

Steam (ST): She'd somehow managed to keep them fooled until this year.
Umineko Project (UP): Through such acting and dodging of questions, she had somehow managed to keep up the bluff until this year.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): So she had slyly been able to trick them somehow until this year.
PC Japanese (JP): そうしてのらりくらりと何とか今年までは誤魔化し通してきた。
Russian (RU): Таким образом, она хитро обманывала их, пока не пришёл этот год.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Através de tal atuação e desvio de questões, de alguma forma ela foi capaz de manter o blefe até este ano.

Steam (ST): Even so, it was probably more realistic than the crazy methods running through her head about getting a boyfriend in the big rush before the cultural festival.
Umineko Project (UP): Even so, it was a little more realistic than the unrealistic method running through her head of getting a boyfriend in a huge hurry before the day of the cultural festival.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Even so, it was probably more realistic than the unrealistic methods running through her head about getting a boyfriend in the big rush before the cultural festival.
PC Japanese (JP): とはいえ、今から文化祭までに大急ぎで彼氏を作るという非現実的な方法に頭を悩ませるよりは、多少は現実的だった。
Russian (RU): Тем не менее, данное предложение звучало более реалистичным, чем проносящиеся в её голове нереальные планы о поспешном нахождении себе парня перед фестивалем.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Ainda assim, era um pouco mais realista que o método irrealista correndo pela cabeça dela de arranjar um namorado em uma enorme pressa antes do dia do festival cultural.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 不過，比起煩惱於“在文化祭前的短短時間裡快速找到個男朋友”這個不怎麼現實的方案，紗音的提議多少來得更現實一些。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 不过，比起烦恼于“在文化祭前的短短时间里快速找到个男朋友”这个不怎么现实的方案，纱音的提议多少来得更现实一些。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Anche così, era probabilmente più realistico che il metodo irreale che le era passato per la testa di trovare un ragazzo in tutta fretta prima del festival culturale.
Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): Tuttavia, se paragonato al doversi scervellare per trovare un metodo implausibile per procurarsi in fretta e furia un ragazzo da lì fino al festival, era una soluzione leggermente più realistica.
Turkish (TR): Yine de, kültür festivali gününden önce büyük bir aceleyle erkek arkadaş edinmek gibi gerçekçi olmayan bir yöntemden farklı olarak biraz daha gerçekçiydi.

Umineko Project (UP): Jessica buried her head in her favorite cushion to hide the fact that her face had grown bright red.

Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Ed erano entrambe nel bel mezzo della pubertà. Non la finivano mai di parlare d'amore. Per questo avevano un rapporto in cui potevano confidarsi su simili questioni.

Steam (ST): But if anyone said that, it would destroy the romantic ideals of a maiden's pure heart and love at first sight.

Speaker: Shannon
Steam (ST): "People who aren't honest with themselves, like you, are... ...what was that word I learned from George-sama...? That's right, I think it was "{c:86ef9c:tsundora}". Apparently, they'll be all the rage in a decade or so."

Steam (ST): Kanon went down the corridor Jessica had shown him...and ran into a temporary stage set up where the vending machines should have been.

Russian (RU): Пройдя по коридору, Канон, как и сказала ему Джессика, набрёл на временную сцену, стоящую там, где полагалось стоять торговым автоматам.

Steam (ST): ...There's no way I'll ever come to a place like this again. Kanon sighed for about the zillionth time that day.
Umineko Project (UP): ...No way I'm ever coming to a place like this again. Kanon sighed for about the hundredth time that day.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): ...There's no way I'll ever come to a place like this again. Kanon sighed for about the zillionth time that day.
PC Japanese (JP): …二度とこんなところ来るもんか。嘉音は今日何度目になるかもわからないため息を漏らすのだった。
Russian (RU): ...Чтоб я ещё раз пошёл в подобное место... Канон уже в миллионный раз за сегодняшний день тяжело вздохнул.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ...Sem chance de eu vir a um lugar como este de novo. Kanon suspirou incontáveis vezes naquele dia.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): …我絕對不會再來這種地方了。嘉音不知道是今天第幾次嘆氣了。
Chinese Simplified (CN): …我绝对不会再来这种地方了。嘉音不知道是今天第几次叹气了。

Turkish (TR): ...Bir daha asla böyle bir yere gelmeyeceğim. Kanon o gün yaklaşık yüzüncü kez iç çekti.

Steam (ST): When he did, the lighting changed, and the standing audience started cheering.
Umineko Project (UP): As he did, the lighting changed, and the standing audience started cheering.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): When he did, the lighting changed, and the standing audience started cheering.
PC Japanese (JP): すると、照明が変わり、立ち見の観客たちが大きな歓声を上げる。
Russian (RU): Как только он это сделал, освещение изменилось, и стоящая публика начала скандировать и аплодировать.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Ao fazer isso, as luzes mudaram, a plateia que estava de pé começou a se animar.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 就在此時，燈光一變，站立旁觀的觀眾們開始熱烈地歡呼了起來。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 就在此时，灯光一变，站立旁观的观众们开始热烈地欢呼了起来。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Quando lo fece, le luci cambiarono, e il pubblico in piedi cominciò ad esultare.
Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): Al che l'illuminazione mutò, e il pubblico in piedi cominciò ad esultare a gran voce.
Turkish (TR): O iç çekerken, tam o sırada ışıklar açıldı ve ayakta duran seyirciler bağırmaya başladı.

Steam (ST): He looked around and realized that there was suddenly a large group of people there. And unlike earlier, they were mostly guys.
Umineko Project (UP): Looking around, I realized that there were suddenly a large number of people here.{n}And unlike earlier, they were all guys.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): When he looked around, he realized that there were suddenly a large number of people here. And unlike earlier, they were all guys.
PC Japanese (JP): 周りを見れば、いつの間にか大勢増えていた。さっきまでと変わって男だらけだ。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 周りを見れば、いつの間にか大勢増えていた。{n}さっきまでと変わって男だらけだ。
Russian (RU): Когда он огляделся по сторонам, то увидел, что здесь внезапно стало очень людно.{n}И в отличии от того, что было раньше, вся толпа состояла из парней.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Olhando em volta, eu percebi que, de repente, havia um grande número de pessoas ao redor. E, diferente de antes, eram todos homens.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 往周圍一看，不知不覺間多了好多人。{n}和剛才完全不同，全是男的。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 往周围一看，不知不觉间多了好多人。{n}和刚才完全不同，全是男的。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Quando si guardò intorno, realizzò che c'erano improvvisamente un gran numero di persone lì. E diversamente da prima, erano tutti ragazzi.
Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): Guardandosi attorno, vide che la folla d'un tratto era aumentata di numero.{n}E diversamente da prima, vi erano un sacco di ragazzi.
Turkish (TR): Etrafıma baktığımda, aniden çok sayıda insanın burada olduğunu fark ettim.{n}Ve öncekinin aksine, hepsi erkekti.

Steam (ST): With this huge crowd, he couldn't even see the stage. Fortunately, there was a fallen beer case nearby, so he tried using that as a footstool.
Umineko Project (UP): With this huge crowd, I couldn't even see the stage. Fortunately, there was a fallen beer case nearby, so I tried using that as a footstool.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): With this huge crowd, he couldn't even see the stage. Fortunately, there was a fallen beer case nearby, and he tried using that as a footstool.
PC Japanese (JP): すごい人垣で舞台すら見えない。運よく、近くにビールケースが転がっていたので、それを踏み台にしてみる。
Russian (RU): В этой огромной толпе он не мог даже увидеть сцену. К счастью, неподалёку валялся ящик из‐под пива, и он воспользовался им как подставкой.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Com essa grande multidão, eu sequer conseguia ver o palco. Por sorte, havia uma caixa de cerveja caída próxima de mim, então eu tentei usá‐la como um escabelo.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 人山人海，連舞台都看不到。幸好邊上就倒著個啤酒箱，我把它當作墊腳台踩了上去。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 人山人海，连舞台都看不到。幸好边上就倒着个啤酒箱，我把它当作垫脚台踩了上去。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Con questa grande folla, non riusciva nemmeno a vedere il palcoscenico. Fortunatamente, c'era un cassa di birra caduta lì vicino, così cercò di usarla come rialzo.
Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): Con una simile moltitudine di persone, non riusciva nemmeno a vedere il palcoscenico. Fortunatamente, lì vicino c'era una cassa di birra rovesciata, così cercò di usarla come sgabello.
Turkish (TR): Bu büyük kalabalık yüzünden sahneyi bile göremiyordum. Neyse ki yakınlarda devrilmiş bir bira kasası vardı, ben de onu tabure olarak kullanmayı denedim.

Steam (ST): When he did, he realized that there was now a new group on the stage.
Umineko Project (UP): And I noticed that there was now a new group on the stage.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): When he did, he realized that there was now a new group on the stage.
PC Japanese (JP): すると舞台の上にはいつの間にか新しいグループが上がっていた。
Russian (RU): Забравшись туда, он понял, что теперь на сцене играла другая группа.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): E percebi que havia um novo grupo no palco.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 舞台上已不知從何時開始換成了別的樂隊。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 舞台上已不知从何时开始换成了别的乐队。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Quando lo fece, realizzò che ora c'era un nuovo gruppo sul palcoscenico.
Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): Quando lo fece, un nuovo gruppo era salito all'improvviso sul palcoscenico.
Turkish (TR): Ve sahnede artık yeni bir grup olduğunu fark ettim.

Steam (ST): Their leader is Milady. She's changed into stage clothes, and she's even holding a guitar. ...I didn't know she could play.
Umineko Project (UP): The leader was Milady. She had changed into stage clothes, and was even holding a guitar. ......I didn't know she could play.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): The leader is Milady. She's changed into stage clothes, and she's even holding a guitar.......I didn't know she could play.
PC Japanese (JP): 先頭はお嬢様だ。舞台用の衣装に着替えられて、ギターなんて持ってる。……知らなかった、弾けたんだ。
Russian (RU): Её лидером была миледи. Она была одета в сценический костюм и даже держала в руках гитару. ......Я и не знал, что она умеет играть.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): A líder era a ojou‐sama. Ela havia colocado as roupas da apresentação, e estava segurando uma guitarra. ......Eu não sabia que ela conseguia tocar.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 站在最前面的是小姐。她換了身上舞台的服裝，還拿著把吉他。……原來小姐還會彈吉他，我還真不知道。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 站在最前面的是小姐。她换了身上舞台的服装，还拿着把吉他。……原来小姐还会弹吉他，我还真不知道。

Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): Il loro capo era la signorina. Si era cambiata nei vestiti di scena, e stava tenendo una chitarra... Non sapevo che sapesse suonare.

Original Witch Hunt (OG): No, maybe she could play. I have seen her practicing air guitar before.
PC Japanese (JP): いや、弾けたのかもしれない。ギターの真似事を練習しているところを見たことはある。

Steam (ST): Natsuhi-sama wouldn't approve of any hobbies outside of study.
Umineko Project (UP): Natsuhi‐sama wouldn't approve of any hobbies outside of study.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Natsuhi-sama wouldn't approve of any hobbies outside of study.

Brazilian Portuguese (PT): A Natsuhi‐sama não aprovaria quaisquer hobbies fora dos estudos.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 夏妃夫人決不容忍朱志香小姐有學習以外的興趣。

Umineko Project (UP): Maybe she was always practicing in secret.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Maybe she was always practicing in secret.

Steam (ST): ...Come to think of it, she's been returning really late from school recently, hasn't she?
Umineko Project (UP): ...Come to think of it, she's been returning really late from school recently, hasn't she?
Original Witch Hunt (OG): [=UP]

Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ...Parando para pensar nisso, ela tem voltado bem tarde da escola ultimamente, não tem?

Steam (ST): ...Maybe she's been practicing at school, far away from Natsuhi-sama's prying eyes.
Umineko Project (UP): ...Maybe she's been practicing at school, far away from Natsuhi‐sama's prying eyes.

Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): Forse si era allenata duramente a scuola, per nascondersi dallo sguardo della signora Natsuhi.

Umineko Project (UP): It really is for the best that Natsuhi‐sama didn't come. ...If Milady were to get scolded by Natsuhi‐sama after putting so many hours of practice in, she would probably be very dejected...

Brazilian Portuguese (PT): É realmente melhor que a Natsuhi‐sama não venha. ...Se a ojou‐sama for repreendida pela Natsuhi‐sama depois de passar tantas horas ensaiando, ela provavelmente vai ficar bem deprimida...
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 果然夏妃夫人不來是做了個正確的決定。…畢竟，要是辛苦練了這麼久的吉他，卻還被責備了，那想必小姐一定是會非常沮喪的…。

Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): È davvero un bene che Natsuhi-sama non sia venuta. ... Se Milady venisse sgridata da Natsuhi-sama dopo aver speso tante ore di pratica, probabilmente si demoralizzerebbe...

Steam (ST): Jessica-sama was in high spirits as they kept shouting "Jessie-sama".
Umineko Project (UP): Jessica‐sama was in great spirits as they kept calling her Jessie‐sama.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Jessica-sama was in great spirits as they kept calling her Jessie-sama.
PC Japanese (JP): ジェシ様と連呼される朱志香さまは大層ご機嫌だった。
Russian (RU): Джессика‐сама была в хорошем расположении духа, а публика продолжала называть её Джесси‐сама.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): A Jessica‐sama estava realmente muito animada por todos continuarem a chamá‐la de Jessie‐sama.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 而被連聲叫著“杰西大人”的朱志香小姐倒是十分高興。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 而被连声叫着“杰西大人”的朱志香小姐倒是十分高兴。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Più continuavamo a chiamarla Jessie-sama e più Jessica-sama era di ottimo umore.
Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): La signorina Jessica, che veniva ripetutamente chiamata ‘Jessie-sama’, era di ottimo umore...
Turkish (TR): Jessica-sama, ona Jessie-sama diye seslenmeye başladıklarından beri çok neşeliydi.

Steam (ST): ...Everyone here was probably a fan. Her mike performance picked up on that and electrified them even more. ...It was almost like a music program on TV.
Umineko Project (UP): ...They were all probably her fans.{n}With her mike performance, she was responding to that and firing the place up.{n}...It was almost like a song program on TV.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): ...Everyone was probably a fan. Her mike performance responded to that and grew more excited....It was almost like a song program on TV.
PC Japanese (JP): …多分、みんなファンなんだろう。マイクパフォーマンスでそれに応えて盛り上げている。…まるでテレビの歌謡番組のようだった。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): …多分、みんなファンなんだろう。{n}マイクパフォーマンスでそれに応えて盛り上げている。{n}…まるでテレビの歌謡番組のようだった。
Russian (RU): ...Скорее всего, это её фанаты.{n}Её исполнение через микрофон ответило на это и стало ещё более оживлённым.{n}...Это было почти как концерт по ТВ.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ...Eles provavelmente eram fãs dela.{n}Com sua performance no microfone, ela respondeu àquilo animando todo o local. ...Era quase como um programa de música da TV.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): …大家應該都是她的粉絲吧。{n}她拿著麥克風，以熱場寒暄響應著呼聲，帶動著全場的氣氛。{n}…簡直就像是電視裡播的歌謠節目一樣。
Chinese Simplified (CN): …大家应该都是她的粉丝吧。{n}她拿着麦克风，以热场寒暄响应着呼声，带动着全场的气氛。{n}…简直就像是电视里播的歌谣节目一样。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): ... Probabilmente erano tutti fan. La sua performance al microfono rispose alle loro chiamate e fece crescere l'emozione. ... Era quasi come un programma sulle canzoni in TV.
Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): Probabilmente erano tutti suoi fan.{n}La sua performance al microfono fece leva su tale aspetto, e li elettrizzò ancora di più...{n}Era proprio come un programma di musica in TV.
Turkish (TR): ...Muhtemelen hepsi onun hayranlarıydı.{n}Mikrofon performansıyla buna karşılık veriyor ve ortamı ateşliyordu.{n}...Neredeyse televizyondaki bir müzik programı gibiydi.

Steam (ST): .........At first, he'd thought this was all silly, but that feeling had changed into appreciation. It was incredible, in its own way.
Umineko Project (UP): ............At first, I had thought all this was frivolous, but that feeling now changed into appreciation—this was pretty incredible in its own way.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): ............At first, he thought it was superficial, but that feeling had changed into appreciation. It was pretty incredible.
PC Japanese (JP): …………最初は軽薄だなと思っていたが、これはこれですごいなと評価を改めた。
Russian (RU): ............Сначала он отнесся к этому поверхностно, но потом на смену этому чувству пришло понимание. Это было просто замечательно.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ............Primeiramente, eu pensei que aquilo tudo fosse frívolo, mas esse sentimento mudou para apreciação. Isso é bem incrível de sua própria forma.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): …………雖然一開始還覺得這太輕佻，不過我現在也有點刮目相看了，覺得這倒也蠻厲害的。
Chinese Simplified (CN): …………虽然一开始还觉得这太轻佻，不过我现在也有点刮目相看了，觉得这倒也蛮厉害的。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): ... All'inizio, pensava fosse superficiale, ma quel sentimento si trasformò in apprezzamento. Era abbastanza incredibile.
Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): All'inizio pensai che fosse qualcosa di frivolo, ma il mio giudizio si trasformò in apprezzamento.
Turkish (TR): ............Başta tüm bunların anlamsız olduğunu düşünmüştüm, ama bu his şimdi takdire dönüştü—bu kendi tarzında oldukça inanılmazdı.

Steam (ST): Kanon never listened to music of his own free will, but he'd often heard the kind of music the Ushiromiya family liked.
Umineko Project (UP): Kanon had never listened to music of his own free will, but he had often heard the kind of music that the people of the Ushiromiya family liked.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Kanon had never listened to music of his own free will, but he had often heard the kind of music that the people of the Ushiromiya family liked.
PC Japanese (JP): 嘉音は進んで音楽を聞くことはないが、右代宮家の人間が好んで聞く音楽はよく耳にした。
Russian (RU): Канон никогда не слушал музыку по собственной воле, но ему часто доводилось слушать музыку, нравившуюся членам семьи Уширомия.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Kanon nunca havia escutado música por sua própria vontade antes, mas ele costumava ouvir o mesmo tipo de música que os membros da família Ushiromiya apreciavam.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 嘉音雖然沒主動聽過音樂，但右代宮家裡人愛聽的音樂倒是時常能聽到。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 嘉音虽然没主动听过音乐，但右代宫家里人爱听的音乐倒是时常能听到。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Kanon non aveva mai sentito la musica di suo volere, ma aveva spesso sentito vari generi di musica che piacevano ai componenti della famiglia Ushiromiya.
Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): Kanon non ascoltava mai musica per conto suo, ma aveva sentito spesso i generi scelti dai membri della famiglia Ushiromiya...
Turkish (TR): Kanon kendi isteğiyle hiç müzik dinlememişti ama Ushiromiya ailesinin sevdiği türden müzikleri sık sık duymuştu.

Steam (ST): ...Since it was almost all classical, Kanon had naturally taken a liking to that kind of music.
Umineko Project (UP): ...Since that was almost all classical music, Kanon had naturally started liking classical music too.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): [=UP]
PC Japanese (JP): …それらはほとんどがクラシックだったため、嘉音もクラシック音楽を自然と好むようになっていた。
Russian (RU): ...Поскольку это в основном была классическая музыка, то совершенно естественно, что Канону она тоже начала нравиться.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ...Como era quase tudo música clássica, Kanon naturalmente passou a gostar de música clássica também.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): …由於那些音樂基本上都是古典樂，所以嘉音也自然而然地對古典樂產生了喜愛。
Chinese Simplified (CN): …由于那些音乐基本上都是古典乐，所以嘉音也自然而然地对古典乐产生了喜爱。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): ... Siccome era quasi tutta musica classica, anche a Kanon gli iniziò a piacere.
Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): Dato che era quasi tutta musica classica, anche Kanon era automaticamente arrivato a prediligere quel tipo di melodie...
Turkish (TR): ...Bunların neredeyse tamamı klasik müzik olduğu için Kanon da doğal olarak klasik müzikten hoşlanmaya başlamıştı.

Steam (ST): ...So to Kanon, the song Jessica sang was...how should you say it... ...Extremely colorful.
Umineko Project (UP): ...So to Kanon, the songs Jessica and the others were singing were...how should you say it............very modern.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): ...So to Kanon, the song Jessica sang was, how should you say it, ............very highly colored.
PC Japanese (JP): …そんな嘉音にとって、朱志香たちが歌う歌は何と言うかその、…………非常にハイカラなものだった。
Russian (RU): ...Поэтому для Канона песня, исполняемая Джессикой, была, как бы это сказать... Полна красок.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ...Então, para Kanon, as músicas que Jessica e as outras estavam cantando era...como você poderia dizer............bem modernas.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): …對這樣的嘉音來說，朱志香她們唱的歌該怎麼說好呢，…………應該說是非常時髦的吧。
Chinese Simplified (CN): …对这样的嘉音来说，朱志香她们唱的歌该怎么说好呢，…………应该说是非常时髦的吧。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): ... Così per Kanon, la canzone che cantava Jessica era, come dire... molto energica.
Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): Per uno come Kanon, il pezzo cantato da Jessica e il suo gruppo era, come dire...Decisamente appariscente.
Turkish (TR): ...Yani Kanon'a göre Jessica ve diğerlerinin söylediği şarkılar...nasıl denir............çok moderndi.

Steam (ST): In any case, if Natsuhi-sama heard it, she'd probably faint.
Umineko Project (UP): In any case, he thought that if Natsuhi‐sama heard it, she would probably faint.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): An any case, if Natsuhi-sama heard it, she would probably faint.
PC Japanese (JP): 少なくとも、夏妃さまが聞かれたら卒倒しそうな雰囲気だった。
Russian (RU): Если бы Нацухи‐сама услышала эту песню, то она, скорее всего, упала бы в обморок.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): De qualquer forma, eu pensei que se a Natsuhi‐sama ouvisse isso, ela provavelmente iria desmaiar.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 至少是能讓夏妃夫人聽了會暈倒的氣氛。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 至少是能让夏妃夫人听了会晕倒的气氛。

Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): Se l'avesse sentito la signora Natsuhi, come minimo probabilmente sarebbe svenuta.
Turkish (TR): Her halükarda, Natsuhi-sama'nın bunu duyarsa muhtemelen bayılacağını düşündü.

Steam (ST): But everyone looked like they were having a really good time.
Umineko Project (UP): But everyone looked like they were having a really good time.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): But everyone looked like they were having a really good time.

Chinese Traditional (CHT): 不過，大家看起來都十分高興。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 不过，大家看起来都十分高兴。

Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): Ma tutti sembravano divertirsi molto.
Turkish (TR): Ama herkes gerçekten iyi vakit geçiriyor gibi görünüyordu.

Steam (ST): Some die-hard fans, who had even brought pen-lights, sang along and danced crazily with the same movements, almost as though it had been planned ahead.
Umineko Project (UP): The die‐hard fans, who had even brought pen‐lights, sang along, dancing crazily with the exact same movements, almost as though it had been planned ahead.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): The die-hard fans who had even brought pen-lights sang along, dancing crazily with the same movements, almost as though it had been planned ahead.
PC Japanese (JP): ペンライトまで持ち込んでいる熱心な観客たちは歌に合わせて、まるで事前に取り決めていたかのようにぴったりと同じ動作で踊り狂っている。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): ペンライトまで持ち込んでいる熱心な観客たちは歌に合わせて、まるで事前に取り決めていたかのようにぴったりと同じ動作で踊り騒いでいる。
Russian (RU): Хардкорные фанаты, которые даже принесли ручки с подсветкой, подпевали и танцевали, повторяя те же движения, как будто спланировали это заранее.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Os fãs mais assíduos, que trouxeram até bastões luminosos, cantavam juntos, dançando alucinadamente exatamente os mesmos movimentos, quase como se aquilo tivesse sido planejado.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 連螢光棒都拿來了的熱心觀眾們配合著歌曲，簡直就像是事先說好了似的，以整齊劃一的動作狂舞著。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 连荧光棒都拿来了的热心观众们配合着歌曲，简直就像是事先说好了似的，以整齐划一的动作狂舞着。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): I fan che avevano perfino portato le lucette cantavano insieme, ballando con gli stessi movimenti, come se fosse stato già programmato.
Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): Alcuni spettatori sfegatati, che avevano portato persino degli stick luminosi, seguivano la musica, ballando e muovendosi all'unisono in preda al delirio, come se fosse stata un'idea pianificata da tempo.
Turkish (TR): Yanlarında kalem ışıkları bile getirmiş olan fanatik hayranlar, sanki önceden planlanmış gibi, birebir aynı hareketlerle çılgınca dans ediyorlar ve şarkı söylüyorlardı.

Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): Anche la signorina Jessica, madida di sudore, cantava con entusiasmo sul palco...

Speaker: Ushiromiya Jessica
Steam (ST): "Again, today, behind me, the sound of footsteps! Oyashiro-sama is stalking me! Curses, disappearances, sacrifices, torture, Onikakushi, does that make a good snack?! Don't say Marisaaaaaaaaaaaaa!!!"
Umineko Project (UP): "Thank you!! OK, next up, we've got a brand new one for you! Don't Call Me An Ordinary Magician!!"
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "Again, today, behind me, the sound of footsteps! Oyashiro-sama is stalking! Curses, disappearances, sacrifices, torture, Onikakushi, do you eat it?! Don't say {c:86EF9C:Marisaaaaaaaaaaaaa}!!!"
PC Japanese (JP): 「今日も背後に足音ひたひた！　オヤシロ様がストーキーングッ！　祟りに失踪、生贄拷問、鬼隠しってつまみ食い？！魔理沙って言うなァアアァぁああぁあぁ！！！」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「ありがとー！　じゃあ次は新曲いっちゃうよ！　普通の魔法使いって言うな！！」
Russian (RU): "Благодарю! Тогда, дальше новая часть! 'Как говорил обыкновенный колдун!!!'"
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Obrigada!! Certo, em seguida, temos uma música nova para vocês! Não Diga que Sou uma Maga Comum!!"
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「謝謝大家！接下來給你們來首新曲！不要叫我普通的魔法師！！」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「谢谢大家！接下来给你们来首新曲！不要叫我普通的魔法师！！」
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): "Grazieee!! Bene, adesso passiamo alla prossima canzone! ‘Non darmi della maga qualunque’!!"
Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): [=ITA]
Turkish (TR): "Teşekkürleeeer!! Pekâlâ, şimdi sırada sizin için yepyeni bir şarkı var! Bana Sıradan Bir Sihirbaz Deme!!"

Steam (ST): ...I must not go along with it, but... ...At any rate, Milady is full of life and looks like she's having a great time.
Umineko Project (UP): ...I couldn't keep up with the atmosphere, but.........anyway, Milady was full of life and looked like she was having a great time.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): ...I must not go along with it, but.........Anyway, Milady is full of life and looks like she's having a great time.
PC Japanese (JP): …ノリには付いていけないが。……とにかくお嬢様はすごく楽しそうで生き生きとしていた。

Steam (ST): As I watched Milady enjoying herself, I thought.
Umineko Project (UP): As I looked at Milady having a great time, I thought...

PC Japanese (JP): 楽しそうにしているお嬢様を見ていて思う。

Steam (ST): Could this be Ushiromiya Jessica's true nature?
Umineko Project (UP): Isn't this what Ushiromiya Jessica is really like?
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Isn't this Ushiromiya Jessica's true form?
PC Japanese (JP): これが、本当の右代宮朱志香の姿なんじゃないだろうか。
Russian (RU): А не это ли настоящая Джессика Уширомия?
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Não é isso que a Ushiromiya Jessica realmente gosta?
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 是不是現在的她，才是右代宮朱志香真正的樣子呢。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 是不是现在的她，才是右代宫朱志香真正的样子呢。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Questa... non è forse la vera forma di Jessica Ushiromiya?
Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): Poteva essere quella la natura della vera Jessica Ushiromiya...?
Turkish (TR): Ushiromiya Jessica gerçekten böyle biri değil miydi?

Steam (ST): ...Don't I know better than anyone...that during her life on Rokkenjima, she's had no choice but to kill her sense of self?
Umineko Project (UP): ...Don't I know better than anyone just how badly life on Rokkenjima kills your own sense of self?
Original Witch Hunt (OG): ...Don't I know best that during her life on Rokkenjima, she'd had no choice but to kill her sense of self?
PC Japanese (JP): …六軒島での暮らしが、如何に自分というものを殺されるかは他でもない、僕が一番知っているじゃないか。
Russian (RU): ...Не мне ли отлично известно, что во время жизни на Роккенджиме ей не оставалось ничего иного, кроме как полностью подавить собственное "я"?
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ...Eu não sei melhor do que ninguém o quão dura é a vida em Rokkenjima, capaz de matar o seu senso de si mesmo?
Chinese Traditional (CHT): …最清楚小姐在六軒島的生活是有多麼抹殺自我的人，不是別人，正是我自己啊。
Chinese Simplified (CN): …最清楚小姐在六轩岛的生活是有多么抹杀自我的人，不是别人，正是我自己啊。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): ... Non so più di tutti che durante la sua vita a Rokkenjima, non aveva altra scelta che uccidere il suo essere se stessa?
Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): Non sapevo meglio di chiunque altro che la vita a Rokkenjima non lasciava altra scelta, se non quella di reprimere se stessi?
Turkish (TR): ...Rokkenjima'daki yaşamın insanın benlik duygusunu ne kadar kötü bir şekilde öldürdüğünü herkesten iyi bilmiyor muydum?

Steam (ST): So the time she spends...not as Milady, successor to the Ushiromiya family, but as a single girl called Jessica, living life to the fullest, must be very important to her.
Umineko Project (UP): Then the time she spends, ...not as Milady, the successor to the Ushiromiya family, but as a single girl called Jessica, living life to the fullest, must be very important to her.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Then the time she spent, ...not as Milady, the successor to the Ushiromiya family, but as a single girl called Jessica, living life to the fullest, must have been very important to her.
PC Japanese (JP): なら、…右代宮家の跡継ぎとしてのお嬢様でない、朱志香というひとりの少女として生き生きできる時間がとても大切なものに違いない。
Russian (RU): Тогда время, проведённое ею ...не как миледи, наследницей семьи Уширомия, но как простой девушкой по имени Джессика, живя на полную катушку, должно быть было очень дорого для неё.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Então o tempo que ela passou, ...não como a ojou‐sama, a sucessora da família Ushiromiya, mas como uma simples garota chamada Jessica, vivendo a vida ao seu máximo, deve ser muito importante para ela.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 既然如此，…那這段並非是作為右代宮家繼承者的千金小姐，而是作為名叫朱志香的一名少女的，能夠自由自在度過的時間，無疑是彌足珍貴的。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 既然如此，…那这段并非是作为右代宫家继承者的千金小姐，而是作为名叫朱志香的一名少女的，能够自由自在度过的时间，无疑是弥足珍贵的。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Allora il tempo speso... non come Milady, successore della famiglia Ushiromiya, ma come una ragazza single chiamata Jessica, che vive la vita al massimo, deve essere stato molto importante per lei.
Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): Per cui, il tempo che trascorreva non come la signorina erede della famiglia Ushiromiya... ma come la ragazza single di nome Jessica, che viveva la vita al massimo, doveva senz'altro essere molto importante per lei...
Turkish (TR): Öyleyse zamanını, ...Ushiromiya ailesinin varisi olan Leydi olarak değil de, Jessica adında bir kız olarak, hayatı dolu dolu yaşayarak geçirmesi onun için çok önemli olmalı.

Steam (ST): ...I've worked close to Milady, seeing her in all seasons, and thought I knew everything about her.
Umineko Project (UP): ...I worked close to Milady, saw her in all seasons, and I thought I knew everything about her.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): [=UP]
PC Japanese (JP): …自分はお嬢様の近くに仕え、春夏秋冬の全ての姿を見て、その全てを知り尽くしているつもりでいた。

Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ...Eu trabalhei perto dela, a vi em todas as estações, e pensei que soubesse tudo sobre ela.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): …我在小姐身邊工作，把小姐春夏秋冬的各種樣子全看在了眼裡，自以為了解了她的一切。
Chinese Simplified (CN): …我在小姐身边工作，把小姐春夏秋冬的各种样子全看在了眼里，自以为了解了她的一切。

Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): Avevo lavorato a fianco della signorina, osservandola in tutti i periodi dell'anno, e credevo di sapere ogni cosa su di lei...
Turkish (TR): ...Leydi'ye oldukça yakın çalışıyordum, onu her mevsim görüyordum ve onun hakkında her şeyi bildiğimi sanıyordum.

Steam (ST): ...But that was all limited to one side of her, the Milady of Rokkenjima.
Umineko Project (UP): ...But that was only a single limited side of her, Milady of Rokkenjima.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): ...But that was only limited to one side of her, Milady of Rokkenjima.

Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ...Mas essa era apenas um lado dela único e limitado, a ojou‐sama de Rokkenjima.

Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): Ma tutto questo non era che uno dei suoi lati, ristretto al ruolo di signorina a Rokkenjima...
Turkish (TR): ...Ama bu onun—Rokkenjima'lı Leydi'nin—sadece sınırlı bir yanıydı.

Steam (ST): ...We are furniture. We serve on Rokkenjima and end our lives on Rokkenjima.
Umineko Project (UP): ......We are furniture.{n}We serve on Rokkenjima, and end our lives on Rokkenjima.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): ......We are furniture. We serve on Rokkenjima, and end our lives on Rokkenjima.
PC Japanese (JP): ……僕らは家具。六軒島で仕え、六軒島で生を終える。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): ……僕らは家具。{n}六軒島で仕え、六軒島で生を終える。

Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ......Nós somos mobílias.{n}Nós servimos em Rokkenjima, e terminamos nossas vidas em Rokkenjima.

Steam (ST): ...So I've come to think of Rokkenjima itself as our whole world. As though, like in Ptolemaic theory, the ocean spilled off the end of the world into an abyss.
Umineko Project (UP): ...So I had come to think that Rokkenjima itself was our whole world, as though—just like in the old geocentric theories—the ocean spilled off the end of the world into an abyss.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): ...So I had come to think that Rokkenjima itself was our whole world, as though, like in Ptolemaic theory, the ocean spilled off the end of the world into an abyss.
PC Japanese (JP): …だから六軒島こそが世界の全てで、六軒島の外など天動説の世界のように、世界の淵から海が零れ落ちているんじゃないかと思ってきた。
Russian (RU): ...Поэтому я начал думать, что Роккенджима сама по себе является нашим миром, совсем как по теории Птолемея, гласящей, что океан простирается до самого края земли, после чего падает в бездну.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ...Por isso eu havia pensado que Rokkenjima em si era nosso mundo todo, como se — assim como nas velhas teorias geocêntricas — o oceano derramasse no fim do mundo em um abismo.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): …所以心裡一直以為，六軒島會不會就是整個世界，六軒島外面會不會就如天動說的世界一般，大海從世界邊緣滾滾傾瀉進無盡的深淵。
Chinese Simplified (CN): …所以心里一直以为，六轩岛会不会就是整个世界，六轩岛外面会不会就如天动说的世界一般，大海从世界边缘滚滚倾泻进无尽的深渊。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): ... Così ho sempre pensato che Rokkenjima fosse il nostro mondo intero, come se, come nella Teoria tolemaica, l'oceano si rovesciava alla fine del mondo negli abissi.
Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): Perciò arrivai a concepire Rokkenjima stessa come se fosse un mondo completo, e che al di là di Rokkenjima, come in base ai dettami della teoria tolemaica,l'oceano cadesse giù dai confini del mondo.
Turkish (TR): ...Böylece Rokkenjima'nın kendisinin tüm dünyamız olduğunu düşünmeye başlamıştım—tıpkı eski jeosentrik teorilerde olduğu gibi—sanki okyanus dünyanın ucundan bir boşluğa akıyordu.

Steam (ST): But when I look at Milady like this, I can see how horribly narrow that outlook is.

Speaker: Ushiromiya Krauss
Steam (ST): "That experience of standing above people and bearing responsibility will surely prove useful in the future. I'm sure it will help Jessica mature as a member of the Ushiromiya family."
Umineko Project (UP): "The experience of standing above people and bearing responsibility will definitely be useful in the future. It will surely help you mature as a member of the Ushiromiya family."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "The experience of standing above people and bearing responsibility will surely be useful in the future. I am sure that Jessica will mature as a member of the Ushiromiya family."
PC Japanese (JP): 「人の上に立ち、責任を背負うという経験は、必ず将来役に立つ。右代宮家の人間として、きっと朱志香を成熟させてくれるだろう。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「人の上に立ち、責任を背負うという経験は、必ず将来役に立つ。右代宮家の人間として、きっと朱志香を成熟させてくれるだろう」
Russian (RU): "Опыт возглавлять людей и нести ответственность, несомненно, принесёт пользу в будущем. Я уверен, что Джессика вырастет достойным членом семьи Уширомия."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "A experiência de ficar acima das pessoas e carregar responsabilidade definitivamente será útil no futuro. Isso certamente irá ajudá‐la a amadurecer como um membro da família Ushiromiya."

Chinese Simplified (CN): 「立于他人之上，背负起责任的经验，必定会在将来派上用场。作为右代宫家的人，这经历一定能使朱志香变得更加成熟吧。」
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): "L'esperienza di stare davanti a tante persone e avere delle responsabilità sarà sicuramente utile in futuro. Sono sicura che Jessica maturerà come un membro della famiglia Ushiromiya."
Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): "Questa esperienza nel guidare gli altri e assumersi responsabilità sicuramente nel futuro si rivelerà utile. Sono certa che aiuterà Jessica a maturare nel ruolo di membro della famiglia Ushiromiya."

Speaker: Ushiromiya Natsuhi
Steam (ST): "But you rushed a little while giving the greeting. You get a pass on content, but the fast pace of your speech lessened the impact. It might help if you developed a habit of pausing every once in a while."
Umineko Project (UP): "But you spoke the greeting a little quickly. You passed on content, but your fast style of speech dilutes it. It would be good if you developed a habit of taking a breath every once in a while."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "But you spoke the greeting a little quickly. You passed on content, but your fast style of speech was lacking. It would be good if you developed a habit of taking a breath every once in a while."
PC Japanese (JP): 「ただ、挨拶が少し早口でした。内容は及第点でしたが、早い口調はそれを薄れさせます。一呼吸置く癖をつけるといいでしょう。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「ただ、挨拶が少し早口でした。内容は及第点でしたが、早い口調はそれを薄れさせます。一呼吸置く癖をつけるといいでしょう」
Russian (RU): "Но ты проговорила приветствие слишком быстро. Ты передала содержание, но твой беглый стиль речи не без недостатков. Было бы неплохо, если бы ты выработала привычку иногда делать передышку."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Mas você falou a saudação um pouco rápido. Você passou em conteúdo, mas seu estilo de fala dilui isso. Seria bom se você desenvolvesse um hábito de respirar de vez em quando."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「只不過，致詞稍微說得有點太快了。雖然內容剛好及格，但說得太快使之缺少了味道。最好養成個隔一會喘口氣的習慣。」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「只不过，致词稍微说得有点太快了。虽然内容刚好及格，但说得太快使之缺少了味道。最好养成个隔一会喘口气的习惯。」
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): "Però il discorso di benvenuto era un po' concitato. I contenuti andavano bene, ma andavi troppo veloce. Sarebbe meglio che tu sviluppassi l'abitudine di prendere fiato ogni tanto."
Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): "Ma durante i saluti sei andata un po' di fretta. Il contenuto era passabile, ma la velocità con cui parlavi ne ha diminuito l'impatto. Sarebbe meglio se prendessi l'abitudine di porre nei tuoi discorsi delle piccole pause."
Turkish (TR): "Ama selamlamayı biraz hızlı yaptın. İçeriği iyi aktardın ama hızlı konuşma tarzın içeriği sulandırıyor. Arada bir nefes alma alışkanlığı geliştirirsen iyi olur."

Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ......Ridículo. No fim, sou só uma garota mimada.{n}Não consigo acreditar em mim mesma — chega a ser engraçado.

Steam (ST): Jessica's expression became the one she always wore when looking at Kanon. The listless Jessica from a second ago was gone.
Umineko Project (UP): Jessica's expression had become the one Kanon always saw.{n}The listless Jessica from a second ago was gone.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Jessica's expression became the one she always had when looking at Kanon. The listless Jessica from a second ago was gone.
PC Japanese (JP): 朱志香の表情は、嘉音がいつも見るそれになっていた。ついさっきまでの物憂げな朱志香ではない。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 朱志香の表情は、嘉音がいつも見るそれになっていた。{n}ついさっきまでの物憂げな朱志香ではない。
Russian (RU): Выражение лица Джессики стало тем, которое оно всегда приобретало, когда она смотрела на Канона.{n}От вялой Джессики не осталось и следа.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): A expressão de Jessica havia se tornado aquela que Kanon sempre via.{n}A Jessica apática de um segundo atrás desapareceu.

Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): L'espressione di Jessica divenne quella che Kanon vedeva abitualmente.{n}Non era più la Jessica malinconica di un secondo prima.

Steam (ST): If he had still only known Jessica as the eventual successor to the Ushiromiya family, as he had until yesterday, ...he might have mistakenly thought that Jessica's mood had sprung back to normal.
Umineko Project (UP): If he still only knew Jessica as the successor to the Ushiromiya family, as he did until today, ...he would have mistakenly thought that Jessica's mood had sprung back to normal.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): If he had still only known of Jessica as the successor to the Ushiromiya family, as he had until yesterday, ...he would have mistakenly thought that Jessica's mood had sprung back to normal.
PC Japanese (JP): それは、右代宮本家跡継ぎの朱志香しか知らなかった昨日までの自分だったなら、…朱志香はもう吹っ切れて元気を取り戻したと勘違いをするところだろう。
Russian (RU): Если бы Канон знал Джессику только как преемницу семьи Уширомия, как было до вчерашнего дня... То ошибочно бы посчитал, что настроение Джессики пришло в норму.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Se ele ainda conhecesse Jessica apenas como a sucessora da família Ushiromiya, como ele fez até hoje, ...ele teria erroneamente pensado que o humor de Jessica havia dado um salto de volta ao normal.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 如果我還是那個昨天之前的我，那個只認識作為右代宮本家繼承者的朱志香的我的話，…那麼我一定會把這誤會成，朱志香已經扔掉了心中的委屈，重新打起精神來了吧。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 如果我还是那个昨天之前的我，那个只认识作为右代宫本家继承者的朱志香的我的话，…那么我一定会把这误会成，朱志香已经扔掉了心中的委屈，重新打起精神来了吧。

Speaker: Ushiromiya Jessica

Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): "Ma quando non sei Kanon-kun, penso che sarebbe giusto che tu viva molto, molto più liberamente."

Steam (ST): Those words definitely weren't just lip-service.
Umineko Project (UP): Those words definitely weren't just lip‐service.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Those words definitely weren't just lip-service.

Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Aquelas palavras definitivamente não eram só da boca para fora.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 這句話絕不是光耍耍嘴皮子而已。

Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Quelle non erano di certo parole ipocrite.
Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): Quelle parole non erano affatto dette tanto per dare fiato alla bocca.
Turkish (TR): Bu sözler kesinlikle laf olsun diye söylenmemişti.

Steam (ST): Jessica had also been like this in the past. She had cursed her own birth into an environment different from all of her friends at school.
Umineko Project (UP): Jessica had also been like this in the past.{n}She had cursed her own birth into an environment different from all of her friends at school.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Jessica had also been like this in the past. She had cursed her own birth into an environment different from all of her friends at school.
PC Japanese (JP): かつての朱志香もそうだった。学校のどの友達とも異なる境遇に、自らの生まれを呪った。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): かつての朱志香もそうだった。{n}学校のどの友達とも異なる境遇に、自らの生まれを呪った。
Russian (RU): Джессика тоже была такой в прошлом.{n}Она проклинала собственное рождение в среде, столь отличающейся от среды всех её школьных друзей.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Jessica também havia sido assim no passado.{n}Ela havia amaldiçoado seu próprio nascimento em um ambiente diferente de todos os seus amigos na escola.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 朱志香曾經也是如此。{n}她也曾為那與學校中的所有朋友都不同的境遇，詛咒過自己的出生。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 朱志香曾经也是如此。{n}她也曾为那与学校中的所有朋友都不同的境遇，诅咒过自己的出生。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Anche Jessica era stata così in passato. Aveva maledetto la sua nascita in un ambiente differente da tutte le altre sue amiche a scuola.
Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): Anche Jessica era stata così in passato.{n}Aveva maledetto il suo esser nata in un ambiente differente da quello di tutte le sue amiche di scuola.
Turkish (TR): Jessica da geçmişte böyleydi.{n}Okuldaki tüm arkadaşlarından farklı bir ortamda dünyaya gelmeyi kendi elleriyle lanetlemişti.

Steam (ST): Only she had been in a heavily constricted environment, forced to learn all sorts of things, and she had even been told whom she was and wasn't allowed to play with.
Umineko Project (UP): She had been the only one in a heavily constricted environment, forced to learn various things, and she had even received words about the friends she played with.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Only she had been in a heavily constricted environment. forced to learn various things, and it had even interfered with the friends she had played with.
PC Japanese (JP): 自分だけが厳しく窮屈な境遇で、様々な習い事を押し付けられ、遊ぶ友人にまで口出しをされた。
Russian (RU): Лишь ей приходилось вращаться в строго ограничивающей её среде, вынуждающей её учиться разным вещам, и порой это даже вмешивалось в отношения с друзьям, с которыми она играла.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Ela havia sido a única a viver em um ambiente estritamente restrito, forçada a aprender inúmeras coisas, e sua mãe chegou até mesmo a determinar coisas como os amigos que ela podia ou não brincar.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 只有自己過著受嚴格約束的生活，被強迫著學各種各樣的東西，就連和誰一起玩都要被干預。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 只有自己过着受严格约束的生活，被强迫着学各种各样的东西，就连和谁一起玩都要被干预。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Solo lei si era trovata in un ambiente pesantemente ristretto, obbligata ad imparare varie cose, e ciò interferiva perfino con le amiche con cui giocava.
Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): Solo lei viveva in un'atmosfera severa e opprimente, costretta a tenere diverse lezioni, e dove le veniva detto persino con quali amici giocare...
Turkish (TR): Oldukça yoğun bir ortamda tek başına kalmış, çeşitli şeyler öğrenmeye zorlanmış, ve hatta birlikte oynadığı arkadaşları hakkında bile kötü sözler duymuştu.

Steam (ST): ...It may have been sad, but she'd given up, resigning herself to the fact that she'd been born under that kind of star.
Umineko Project (UP): ......Though she had been sad about that, she had given up, thinking that she had just been born under that kind of star.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): ......Even though that was sad, she had given up, thinking that she had just been born under that kind of star.
PC Japanese (JP): ……それが悲しかったけれど、そういう星の下に生まれたんだと諦めてしまっていた。
Russian (RU): ......Пусть это даже и было грустно, она сдалась, думая, что ей было уготовано родиться под такой звездой.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ......Isto pode realmente ter sido algo triste, o que a levou a desistir, pensando que ela apenas havia nascido sob aquele tipo de estrela.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): ……雖然這很可悲，但她自認已經出生在了這樣的星星之下，就此認了命。
Chinese Simplified (CN): ……虽然这很可悲，但她自认已经出生在了这样的星星之下，就此认了命。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): ... Nonostante fosse triste, si era rassegnata, pensando che era semplicemente nata sotto quel tipo di stella.
Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): Era sconsolata, ma finì per rassegnarsi di essere nata sotto quel tipo di stella.
Turkish (TR): ......Buna üzülse de, sadece böyle bir yıldızın altında doğduğunu düşünerek pes etmişti.

Steam (ST): But one day, Jessica stopped giving up and surrendering.
Umineko Project (UP): But one day, Jessica had stopped giving up and surrendering.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): But one day, Jessica had stopped giving up and surrendering.
PC Japanese (JP): でも朱志香はある日、それに諦め屈することをやめた。
Russian (RU): Но однажды Джессика перестала опускать руки и сдаваться.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Mas um dia, Jessica parou de desistir e se render.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 但在某一天，朱志香選擇了不再屈服於這種命運。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 但在某一天，朱志香选择了不再屈服于这种命运。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Ma un giorno, Jessica smise di rassegnarsi e arrendersi.
Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): Ma un giorno, Jessica cessò di cedere di fronte a tale rassegnazione.

Steam (ST): She created a real "Jessica" inside herself, one who could do what she really wanted to do.
Umineko Project (UP): She created a real "Jessica" inside herself, who could do what she really wanted to do.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): She had created a real 'Jessica' inside herself, who could do what she really wanted to do.
PC Japanese (JP): 自分が本当にやりたいことをやれる、本当の「朱志香」を、自分の中に生み出したのだ。

Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Ela criou uma "Jessica" de verdade dentro de si mesma, que podia fazer o que ela realmente queria fazer.

Chinese Simplified (CN): 她在自己的心中，创造出了一个能做自己真正想做的事的，真正的「朱志香」。

Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): Diede vita ad una vera ‘Jessica’ dentro di sé, che poteva fare quello che voleva veramente fare.

Speaker: Ushiromiya Jessica
Steam (ST): "You know, I go by the nickname Jessie at school. When I'm Jessie, I live life honestly and to the fullest. And because of that, I can do my best when I'm Jessica too."
Umineko Project (UP): "You know, I'm called by this nickname Jessie in school. So when I'm Jessie, I live life honestly and to the fullest. And because of that, I can do my best when I'm Jessica too."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): [=UP]
PC Japanese (JP): 「私さ、学校ではジェシってあだ名で呼ばれてる。だからさ、ジェシである時は、自分に思い切り素直に生きてる。だからこそ、朱志香である時も頑張れるんだ。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「私さ、学校ではジェシってあだ名で呼ばれてる。だからさ、ジェシである時は、自分に思い切り素直に生きてる。だからこそ、朱志香である時も頑張れるんだ」
Russian (RU): "Ты слышал, как меня называют этим прозвищем Джесси в школе. Когда я являюсь Джесси, я живу честно и на полную катушку. И по этой причине я могу выложиться на полную, даже когда я Джессика."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Sabe, na escola eu sou chamada pelo meu apelido, Jessie. Então quando sou a Jessie, vivo a vida honestamente e ao máximo. E por causa disso, consigo fazer meu melhor quando sou a Jessica também."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「我在學校的時候呀，大家都用杰西這個外號叫我。所以呢，我是杰西的時候，可以按自己的想法不加掩飾地活著。也正因為如此，我才能在是朱志香的時候也同樣拿出幹勁。」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「我在学校的时候呀，大家都用杰西这个外号叫我。所以呢，我是杰西的时候，可以按自己的想法不加掩饰地活着。也正因为如此，我才能在是朱志香的时候也同样拿出干劲。」
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): "Sai, io vengo chiamata con il soprannome Jessie a scuola. Quindi quando sono Jessie, vivo la mia vita spontaneamente e al meglio. E per questo, posso fare del mio meglio anche quando sono Jessica."
Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): "Sai, a scuola mi chiamano Jessie. Perciò, quando sono Jessie, vivo la mia vita quanto più autenticamente posso. E grazie a questo, posso fare del mio meglio anche quando sono Jessica..."
Turkish (TR): "Biliyorsun, okulda bana Jessie lakabıyla seslenirler. Yani Jessie olduğumda hayatı dürüstçe ve dolu dolu yaşıyorum. Ve bu yüzden Jessica olduğumda da elimden gelenin en iyisini yapabiliyorum."

Speaker: Ushiromiya Jessica
Steam (ST): "...Would it really be so bad... if you could also have times when you're Kanon, and times when you're...umm, ...your real name? ...When you aren't Kanon, ...can't you try becoming another self that you can like?"
Umineko Project (UP): "...Maybe you too could have times when you're Kanon, and times when you're, umm, ......your real name, and live a different way in each. ......When you aren't Kanon, ...can't you try being another self who you can grow to like?"
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "...I wonder if it would be alright for you too, to have times when you live as Kanon, and times when you live as, umm, ......your real name. ......When you aren't Kanon, ...can't you become another part of yourself that you can like?"
PC Japanese (JP): 「…嘉音くんにも、嘉音である時と、嘉音じゃなくてその、……本名である時で、違う生き方をしてもいいんじゃないかな。……嘉音じゃない時、…自分を好きになれる自分に、なってみてもいいんじゃないかな。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「…嘉音くんにも、嘉音である時と、嘉音じゃなくてその、……本名である時で、違う生き方をしてもいいんじゃないかな。……嘉音じゃない時、…自分を好きになれる自分に、なってみてもいいんじゃないかな」
Russian (RU): "...Интересно, пошло бы и тебе на пользу время от времени быть Каноном, а в другое время быть, м‐м‐м, человеком с твоим настоящим именем. ......Когда ты не являешься Каноном... Как насчёт того, чтобы быть другим собой, который тебе нравится больше?"
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "...Talvez você também possa ter horas em que você é Kanon, e horas quando você é, hmm, ......seu nome verdadeiro, e viver uma forma diferente em cada. ......Quando você não é Kanon, ...você não pode tentar ser outro "eu" que você pode começar a gostar?"
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「…嘉音君不也可以，在是嘉音的時候，和在不是嘉音，而是以那個，……本名活著的時候，分別去用不同的方式去活嘛。……在不是嘉音的時候，…就去試著成為一個能讓自己喜歡上的自己，不也挺好的嘛。」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「…嘉音君不也可以，在是嘉音的时候，和在不是嘉音，而是以那个，……本名活着的时候，分别去用不同的方式去活嘛。……在不是嘉音的时候，…就去试着成为一个能让自己喜欢上的自己，不也挺好的嘛。」
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): "... Mi chiedo se sarebbe giusto anche per te, avere momenti dove vivi come Kanon, e momenti dove vivi come, umm... il tuo nome vero. ... Quando non sei Kanon... non puoi diventare un'altra parte di te che ti possa piacere?"
Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): "Sarebbe così brutto se anche tu potessi... vivere in un modo quando sei Kanon... e in un altro quando non sei Kanon e usi, ehm... il tuo vero nome...? Quando non sei Kanon... non potresti provare a diventare un altro te stesso che ti possa piacere?"
Turkish (TR): "...Belki senin de Kanon olduğun zamanlar, ve bir de, umm, ......gerçek adınla yaşadığın zamanlar olabilir ve ikisinde de farklı bir şekilde yaşayabilirsin. ......Kanon olmadığın zaman, ...sevebileceğin başka bir ben olmayı deneyemez misin?"

Steam (ST): He'd once thought of his real name as being completely meaningless. Because of that, he'd thought that "Kanon" summed up everything about him.
Umineko Project (UP): He had thought that his real name didn't matter at all.{n}So he had thought Kanon was all he was.

PC Japanese (JP): 本当の名前なんて、どうでもいいものだと思っていた。だから、自分の全てが嘉音だと思った。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 本当の名前なんて、どうでもいいものだと思っていた。{n}だから、自分の全てが嘉音だと思った。

Umineko Project (UP): However, they couldn't escape the fate that made it impossible for them to be joined.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): However, they couldn't escape the fate that made it impossible for them to be joined.

Chinese Simplified (CN): 然而，不能结合的命运是无法逃脱的。

Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): [=ITA]

Steam (ST): Even if they were joined, Shannon and George, Kanon and Jessica would eventually break up. They would wander through an endless desert in this hell of love, tormented by an eternal thirst...!
Umineko Project (UP): Even if they were joined, the relationships of Shannon and George, Kanon and Jessica would fail for certain, and as they wandered through the eternal desert in the hell of love, they would be tormented by eternal thirst...!
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Even if they were joined, the relationships of Shannon and George, Kanon and Jessica would fail, and as they wandered through the eternal desert in the hell of love, they would be tormented by eternal thirst...!
PC Japanese (JP): 仮に結ばれたとて、紗音も譲治も、嘉音も朱志香も、必ず破綻し、恋の地獄にて永遠の砂漠を彷徨いながら、永遠の渇きに苦しむことになる…！
Russian (RU): Даже если их и соединить, то отношения между Шаннон и Джорджем, Каноном и Джессикой ни к чему не приведут, и они будут блуждать по вечной пустыне ада любви, мучаясь от жажды!..
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Mesmo se eles fossem unidos, os relacionamentos de Shannon e George, Kanon e Jessica, falhariam com certeza, e enquanto eles vagavam pelo deserto eterno no inferno do amor, eles seriam atormentados pela sede eterna...!
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 就算結合在了一起，無論是紗音與讓治，還是嘉音與朱志香，他們的戀情都必定會以失敗告終，然後他們便會在戀愛的地獄之中，一邊彷徨於永遠的沙漠，一邊為永遠的乾渴而痛苦…！
Chinese Simplified (CN): 就算结合在了一起，无论是纱音与让治，还是嘉音与朱志香，他们的恋情都必定会以失败告终，然后他们便会在恋爱的地狱之中，一边彷徨于永远的沙漠，一边为永远的干渴而痛苦…！
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Anche se fosse successo, la relazione tra Shannon e George, tra Kanon e Jessica sarebbe fallita, e quando avrebbero vagato attraverso l'eterno deserto nell'inferno dell'amore, sarebbero stati tormentati da una sete eterna...!
Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): Anche se Shannon e George, e Kanon e Jessica si fossero uniti, sarebbero inevitabilmente crollati, vagando per un deserto senza fine dentro ad un inferno d'amore, e tormentati da una sete eterna...!
Turkish (TR): Bir araya gelseler bile Shannon ve George'un, Kanon ve Jessica'nın ilişkileri kesin olarak başarısız olacak, ve aşk cehennemindeki ebedi çölde dolaşırken sonsuz susuzluğun azabını çekeceklerdi...!

Speaker: {f:5:Beatrice}
Steam (ST): "What, did you think I'd lend you my power and ask for nothing in exchange? I'll gladly assist a pair in love. And in exchange, I'll enjoy watching the cruel fate they'll eventually meet. I have never come across a better show, not over the course of a thousand years...!"
Umineko Project (UP): "Did you think I would lend them that power without any compensation? I'll lend a hand in love. And my compensation shall be one ticket to watch the cruel fate that the two of them will eventually meet. Even after one thousand years, no better show exists...!"
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "Did I not lend them that power without asking for compensation? I'll lend a hand in love. So that as compensation, I can enjoy watching the cruel fate that the two of them will eventually meet. Even after one thousand years, no better show exists...!"
PC Japanese (JP): 「妾がその力を対価なく貸すことがあるとでも？　恋に手は貸そう。その対価は、やがて必ず訪れる二人への過酷な運命の鑑賞料としていただくわけよ。これに勝る見世物は千年経っても存在せぬ…！」
Russian (RU): "Разве я не говорила о компенсации, когда помогала им? Я помогла в их любовных делах. Так что в качестве компенсации я могу насладиться созерцанием жестокой судьбы, которую эти двое в конечном итоге встретят. Даже спустя тысячу лет я не нашла лучшего зрелища, чем это!.."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Você achou que eu lhes emprestaria poder sem nenhuma compensação? Darei uma mão no amor. E minha compensação deve ser um ingresso para assistir ao destino cruel que os dois eventualmente encontrarão. Mesmo depois de mil anos, não existe espetáculo melhor...!"
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「汝不會以為妾身借予力量是不要代價的吧？妾身會對戀情出手相助。但殘酷的命運終有一天會降臨在兩人的頭上，這代價嘛，妾身便會作為觀賞費收取。能勝於此的好戲，哪怕過了千年都不會再有…！」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「汝不会以为妾身借予力量是不要代价的吧？妾身会对恋情出手相助。但残酷的命运终有一天会降临在两人的头上，这代价嘛，妾身便会作为观赏费收取。能胜于此的好戏，哪怕过了千年都不会再有…！」
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): "Non ho forse prestato loro quel potere senza chiedere alcun compenso? {n}Ho dato loro una mano riguardo l'amore. Quindi come ricompensa, posso divertirmi guardando il loro destino crudele a cui alla fine andranno incontro. Anche dopo mille anni, non esiste uno spettacolo migliore...!"
Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): "Pensavi che avrei prestato il mio potere senza chiedere nulla in cambio? Assisterò volentieri una coppia in amore. Cosicché, in cambio, mi potrò divertire nell'osservare il destino crudele che coglierà inesorabilmente quei due in futuro. Non mi sono mai imbattuta in uno spettacolo migliore di questo, neanche dopo mille anni...!"
Turkish (TR): "Onlara bu gücü karşılıksız vereceğimi mi sandın? Aşka yardım edeceğim. Ve tazminatım, ikisinin sonunda karşılaşacakları zalim kaderi izlemek için bir bilet olacak. Bin yıl sonra bile, daha iyi bir gösteri yok...!"

Speaker: {f:5:Beatrice}
Steam (ST): "Just look at Kinzo. See how he ended up: an old, pitiful man who learned the taste of love before being thrown out of paradise! Look at how he lives, like a dead man that cannot fully die. *cackle*cackle*!!"
Umineko Project (UP): "Just look at Kinzo. See how he ended up, an old, pitiful man who knew the taste of love and was thrown out of Paradise! Look at how he lives, like a dead man who can't fully die. *cackle*cackle*!!"
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "Just look at Kinzo. See how he ended up, an old, pitiful man who knew the taste of love and was thrown out of paradise! Look at how he lives, like a dead man that can't fully die. *cackle*cackle*!!"
PC Japanese (JP): 「金蔵を見るがいい。恋の味を知り楽園を追放された哀れな老いぼれの末路を！　死んでも死に切れぬさながら亡者のような生き様を見るがいい。くっくっくっくっく！！」
Russian (RU): "Просто взгляни на Кинзо. Посмотри, как он плохо кончил — жалкий старик, познавший вкус любви и выброшенный из рая! Взгляни, как он живёт, совсем как мертвец, который даже не может по‐настоящему умереть. *смешок*смешок*!"
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Apenas olhe para Kinzo. Veja como ele acabou, um homem velho, lamentável que conheceu o sabor do amor e foi jogado para fora do Paraíso! Olhe como ele vive, como um homem morto que não consegue morrer totalmente. *gargalhada*gargalhada*!!"
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「汝且看看金藏。看看那嘗到愛戀的滋味後，被逐出樂園的可悲老東西的下場！汝且看看他那副死都死不透，猶如亡者一般活著的模樣吧。哈哈哈哈哈！！」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「汝且看看金藏。看看那尝到爱恋的滋味后，被逐出乐园的可悲老东西的下场！汝且看看他那副死都死不透，犹如亡者一般活着的模样吧。哈哈哈哈哈！！」
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): "Prendi anche solamente Kinzo. Guarda come è finito, un vecchio, patetico uomo che ha conosciuto il sapore dell'amore ed è stato cacciato via dal paradiso! Guarda come vive, come un uomo morto che non può morire del tutto. *cackle*cackle*!!"
Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): "Guarda Kinzo. Trascorre i suoi ultimi giorni come un vecchiaccio patetico, che ha conosciuto il sapore dell'amore ed è stato cacciato via dal paradiso! Guarda come vive, praticamente identico ad un fantasma che non può completamente morire per via dei suoi rimpianti. Mhmhmhmhmh!!"
Turkish (TR): "Kinzo'ya bak. Aşkın tadını bilen ve cennetten kovulan yaşlı, zavallı bir adamın sonunun nasıl olduğuna bak! Tam olarak ölemeyen ölü bir adam gibi nasıl yaşadığına bir bak. *cackle*cackle*!!"

Speaker: Kanon
Steam (ST): "You truly are a witch. Disappear! Get out of my sight, demon...!!"
Umineko Project (UP): "You really are a witch. Get out of my sight, you demon...!!"
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "You really are a witch. Disappear and get out of my sight, you demon...!!"
PC Japanese (JP): 「やはりお前は魔女だ。消えて失せろ、この悪魔め…ッ！！」
Russian (RU): "Ты и впрямь ведьма. Исчезни, убирайся с глаз моих, ты, демон!.."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Você é realmente uma bruxa. Desapareça, seu demônio...!!"
